author: Scot Ferris
text:
I am looking for examples of how other municipalities staff their front counters.  
Currently our "Land Development/Zoning" front counter is staffed with one full time manager (me), two administrative staff who run the file room, etc.,and a rotating crew of eight planners who come out and work the front counter all day, for one day a week.
Before this arrangement we had one full time manager and two administrative assistants providing the zoning information.  After a RIF where we lost these positions, we went with the current configuration. Our current method ensures that the public gets high quality answers from professional staff, however at the cost of the disruption of the Planners routine.
I am curious as to how other jurisdictions staff their front counters - does anyone else have rotating staff? Full time staff that work nothing but the front counter?  If yes, what level of staff?  How much of a value does your municipality put on this service?
Thanks in advance!
title: Staffing for zoning front counter
